alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Coffey; Douglas; Franklin; Jefferson; Lyon; Osage; Shawnee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 5:18AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Franklin, southeastern Jefferson, southeastern Shawnee, northwestern Anderson, Douglas, Osage, Coffey and southern Lyon Counties through 545 AM CDT... At 518 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles south of McLouth to 5 miles west of Olpe. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lawrence, Emporia, Ottawa, Baldwin City, Osage City, Burlington, Carbondale, Eudora, Richland, Wellsville, Overbrook, Lyndon, Centropolis, Lebo, Pomona, Scranton, Lecompton, Waverly, Clinton and Olpe. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 128 and 198. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 116 and 127, and between mile markers 193 and 205. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CDT for northeastern and east central Kansas.

area.areaDesc: Anderson; Coffey; Douglas; Franklin; Jefferson; Lyon; Osage; Shawnee
